author: {'steamid': '76561198148584288', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1685899787}
review:
Anstrengend zu spielen durch seltsames Gefühl beim Steuern.
Sound sehr verbuggt oder über dramatisch, obwohl nichts geschieht. Atmosphäre nicht wirklich überzeugend, lag aber vielleicht auch daran, dass ich im voraus aufgrund der schlechten Bewertung das Spiel nicht ernst nehmen konnte.
Anfangs Wirkte es noch wie ein Amnesia-Klon welcher aber mit der Zeit stark nachgelassen hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 36, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1711530145}
review:
This is an old action/puzzle FPS with an arcane/magic/haunted house theme.  Run around a mansion, collecting upgrades and weapons and blasting enemies... if the controls work. 

The game is very buggy, the controls don't work properly a lot of the time.  There's little in the way of modern support, and no support for UHD, so the game falls below minimum acceptable standards for PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978221204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1529794975}
review: Anfangs Interessant, nervt aber später durch die miesen Fights und das es einfach nur unfär ist. Atmo und Technik geht in ordnung. Konnte das Spiel nicht Durchspielen, da ich nicht mehr genug Mana hatte und es kein Mana mehr einzusammeln gab. Hätte also wieder von vorne anfangen müssen. Mana wird abgezogen nachdem man von einem unbesiegbaren Gegner gekillt wird der zwischendurch immer mal reingespawnt wird. Passierte bei mir so oft, dass ich mich irgendwie verarscht gefühlt habe. Hab 16 Kugeln in die Pfeiffe reingeballert und nichts ist passiert. Muste irgendwie ständig an den unbesiegbaren Skorpion aus Serious Sam denken der als Kopierschutz eingebaut wurde. Vielleicht habe ichs im Steamsale zu billig erstanden und werde damit jetzt bestraft!? Nee, sorry, aber der Supermanchucknorrisgegner geht garnicht!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028705046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1408171663}
review: Hard to list all of what this game got wrong but man was it bad.  Horror elements are pretty much nonexistent.  You rely on mana to do pretty much everything in this game and you lose some of your max mana every time you die.  It is entirely possible for you to lose enough mana that you cannot progress the story due to lack of mana and at the time I played through it there was no fix.  The game seems to want to be a shooter to an extent but your gun has very limited bullets.  You get one later that uses mana but it only works against a singular enemy type to be prepared to use the axe they give you for the vast majority of your fights.  Gonna leave it at that and seriously recommend people give this game a pass as it just feels like a subpar barely finished game that would be better off as a free download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1503518165}
review:
Tags: 1PHWS - First P. Horror Walk Sim
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Boring. Poor field of vision. Disorienting. Not enough horror. Not enough interactivity. Story ends abruptly. Audio fair bit worse than the visuals. Collecting manapots is tedious. Figuring out puzzles is trial and error, keyfetch and platforming. Narrow corridor level design with disjointed rooms. Makes no sense. Combat was poor pathfinding and AI with limited ammo and auto-regen out of combat.

Seems like on a per-machine basis you might have issues where some of the lighting effects do not work. Leaving you in a much darker play area than necessary. Not a lot of jump scares, long drab sections to walk across. Easy to get disoriented and walk in circles. 

The lore from the journals were voice acted and helped somewhat keep the story together.

Removed for declutter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067585596', 'num_games_owned': 5828, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1502727387}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076314179', 'num_games_owned': 2225, 'num_reviews': 470, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1473695644}
review:
Очередной унылый типа инди типа хоррор от первого лица. Бессмысленный и беспощадный, не нужный и невероятно скучный. 

Снова просыпаемся в каком-то мрачном замке, не помня кто мы, что мы и откуда мы. Гениально, особенно первые 500 раз. Начинаем проходить комнату за комнатой замка, с трудом пытаясь отличить локации друг от друга - это невозможно, ведь они одинаковые. Даже сюжет под это дело приписали, мол мы снова и снова возвращаемся в один наш замок, который мы, разработчики, удосужились забацать. Гуд джоб, гайс!

Записки в журнале? Есть. Поиск ингридиентов и кнопок? Есть. Шорохи, звуки и мрачная музыка? Есть. Получите распишитесь прямиком в глотку тебе, тварь. Через полчаса занудных перемещений по темным углам мы получаем пистолет и топорик - теперь монстров (коих тут 4 вида) можно убивать. Стало лучше? Нет. Идём дальше. С оружием чувствуешь себя увереннее да и смерть не на что не влияет - ты также возрождаешься с уже найденными предметами и можешь дальше бежать по уже изученному уровню. Единственное, что через пару смертей появляется ваш злобный двойник, с которым я бы не хотел встретиться в тёмном переулке. 

Но в целом бояться нечего ибо через полчаса игра становится больше похожа на экшон. Спокойно мутузим врагов и скачем дальше, находим новые ключи, открываем новые двери и находим новые штуки вроде щита, магический ловушки и супер-пушки, работающей на мане игрока.

Пах-шмах-дах-бах конец. Всё давай пока. Зачем они это разрабатывали? Вопрос открыт. 

Зачем я в это играл? 

Ой всё.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993512705', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1409854951}
review: Game showed promise. Short, buggy, uncomfortable in general it still felt a bit somewhat like the great old Clive Barker's Undying. At the end of the game there was clearly a hint for continuation. Then the developer disappeared. The forum's dead, noone's answering. If there's ever going to be the second part, if it will be at least not worse than the first one, this review is gone. Until then-it's an abandonware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040845636', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1463231574}
review:
Blinding Dark starts in a promising way, but soon you'll realise that it's nothing good.

The story is about this guy who wakes up in a manor and doesn't remember anything and tries to figure what is going on. He also has a mask stuck on his face and it whispers things to him, but instead of actually using this as a creepy feature by making the player hear the whispers, you'll have to read about it from the journal that periodically gets updated. The update sound is also used in many other places and I got stuck for a while because I didn't realise the journal had new info on it.

Practically the first enemy you get to kill with a weapon shows you just how the rest of the battles will go. You see an enemy standing further away and shoot at it. You'll notice that you propably missed even if your aim was spot on. You'll then try to aim with iron sight, but then you'll realise that it's completely useless because it shoots way higher than the iron sight shows. Oh, and don't try to get headshots even at close range. The hitboxes aren't that good.

There were maybe two or three jump scares in the very beginning of the game, but as you progress they are completely forgotten, and the game ends up becoming a boring buggy shooter.

And the ending? It was a joke. Instead of having an epic battle, you fight 4 waves of enemies and allows you to move onward, but then the game ends with text "End of act I" and that's it. No act II, even though I think it mentioned somewhere along the way that the collectible items would become useful in act II.

I wouldn't recommend this for the price of 10€, but maybe you'll find it mildly enjoyable for 2 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1439362397}
review:
Juego pastiche donde los haya. Se trata de una especie de survival horror donde han metido en la Thermomix:
- El "Amnesia: The Dark Descent", porque no nos veremos un carajo y tendremos que ir dándonos luz todo el rato. Además, la historia es calcada. Te despiertas sin tener ni zorra de nada y vas por ahí cogiendo notitas.
- El "The Call of Cthulhu: Dark Corners of the Earth", porque además, podremos coger armas y usarlas contra los bichejos y comerciales que tocan a tu puerta a la hora de comer.
- El "Diablo", porque además, tenemos [i]maná[/i], que es [i]la magia[/i] que tiene el personaje (necesaria para usar ciertas armas u objetos).
- El "Call of Duty", porque si te dan muchos golpes seguidos, la espichas, pero si te dan de vez en cuando, te vas regenerando como un campeón de los que hacen [i]running[/i] y se echan más verdura que gintónic en la copa.
- Un juego cualquiera de los 90 con polígonos de esos que no caben en el maletero del coche.

Cuando ya tengas todo en el recipiente de la máquina, dale a máxima potencia durante 3 minutos. El resultado es un truñaco tremendo. Un juego donde los malditos bichos, si te matan varias veces, te van quitando maná, y como el maná es necesario para pasar de un nivel a otro, puedes quedarte atascado en el juego sin posibilidad de avanzar. Además, tienes un contador de resistencia que se gasta si corres o saltas, pero se recupera si andas o te quedas quieto, pero atención: si corres contra una pared, es decir, no te mueves, [b]también te resta[/b]. Y para colmo, si corres hacia atrás, ¡no baja nunca de 100! Jajajajaja.
Sigamos nuestro paseo fecal. La acción transcurre en una mansión, pero una mansión absurda, con trillones de salones casi idénticos unos a otros, y pasillos sin sentido. Por si fuera poco, los polígonos te sacarán los ojos, y se solaparán unos con otros haciendo que separes los dedos del teclado y te preguntes [i]¿qué demonios es esto?[/i]
Este juego se merece un dedo tan para abajo, que atraviesa el planeta y se asoma por el suelo de Nueva Zelanda.

[b]¿Cómo es eso de quedarse atascado?[/b] Pues para acabar el nivel necesitas cierta cantidad de maná para hacer una movida extraña con un espejo mágico, como no tengo maná suficiente porque me han matado varias veces, pues todo lo que puedo hacer es pasearme por el nivel y tocarme los huevos.
[b]¿Has hablado con el desarrollador a ver?[/b] Les he escrito, pero de momento no hay respuesta, y antes que a mí, le ha pasado a más gente, que tampoco tienen respuesta.
[b]Entonces, ¿no te lo has acabado?[/b] No. Lo que hice fue investigar a fondo el nivel y me subí a un sitio que no estaba pensado para que se subiese el jugador y descubrí que el mapa estaba abierto al infinito. Salí y caí para abajo mientras veía como el nivel se iba quedando arriba. Todo era más negro que el ojete de un mandril. Al final me detuve. No se veía nada, sólo las iluminaciones que iba dejando. Decidí echar a andar en línea recta a ver, y tras estar un buen rato caminando, volví a caer de manera infinita y ya lo único que veía, mirara hacia donde mirara, era negror. Aquí decidí que ya había desperdiciado bastante tiempo con esta mierd...

author: {'steamid': '76561197985443104', 'num_games_owned': 1741, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1428110011}
review: Blinding Dark game is one of few horrors where you are constantly horrified to make another step forward. Its music and timing of beings you encounter will never get you relaxed and enjoy the view, because you will continue being scared until you finish the game. It’s quite realistic in terms of staying alive, where with just few hits you will find yourself near the death state. And after being killed you will respawn at a certain place with penalty of losing some part from your total mana points. The story keeps you involved even if its look like there is not much of it, you are provided with a voiced journal of the man you are playing with as he travels along, which are rich in information of what’s really going on around you. Gameplay usually consist of a certain area where you need to solve puzzles in order to open a path ahead. There is a rich variation of weapons u can use, where each weapon are designed to defeat a certain enemy, so you have to be prepared. Know the enemy weakness and select the weapon accordingly. I really enjoyed this horror game. If you really want to remind yourself of being afraid then this is a game you need to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060329972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1427498122}
review: Выиграл игру за 100 рублей и очень обрадовался, ведь за неё просят в пять раз больше. Начал устанавливать и тут на душе снова стало приятно – игра весит всего лишь 1 гигабайт. И третье, что порадовало – это устаревшая графика. И я не шучу. Просто я люблю ретро игры. На этом, собственно говоря, вся радость кончилась. Точнее, она исчезла после минут двадцати в игре. Blinding Dark скучна до отвращения, она монотонна и тягуча. Герой ходит, прыгает, собирает какие-то кристаллы, убегает от монстров и находит зеркала, являющиеся телепортами. Всё это происходит неспешно, словно персонажа окружает тягучий кисель, а не воздух… Оружие в виде пистолета появляется где-то после получаса (!) игры. За это время ничего нового больше не привносится в процесс: те же локации, такие же монстры, те же ящики (всасывающиеся в стены при любом удобном случае)… Очень скучная, однообразная и унылая игра. Абсолютно не рекомендую. Ни стоит она и рубля.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029011512', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1425000227}
review:
Blinding Dark is an immensely short first person horror game clocking around about 2.5 hours if you're not getting stumped or killed constantly. The game is fun and charming to begin with as it's going for a very Clive Barker's Undying style of gameplay as well as some of the funny writing in a specific journal entry citing that the main character might have shit his pants so that was pretty amusing. Things seem alright if somewhat derivitave from the get-go (You lost you memory, in some spoopy place, etc, etc, we've seen it before) but as you get further and further into the game, things start to take a downward spiral from the confusing, to the annoying, to the outright frustrating and then to the utterly disappointing. I like the game in a weird charming way but it doesn't get that 'So bad that it's good' vibe like it had in the beginning as at the end it had more of a 'I feel rather disappointed now' kind of vibe. But I'll break it down to pros and cons because TL;DR amirite?

Pros:
- A refreshing take on the rather dull first person indie horror game
- Weapons to fight monsters
- Some interesting monster and weapon designs, taking from different folklores across the world
- Dark, gothic atmosphere
- Has plenty of old school elements, running around collecting random items is quite fun
- First person platforming is actually not bad, utilizing the sprint and jump keys properly can take you far
- Some fairly unique weapons, ranging from the standard revolver up to a large shield to deflect enemy projectiles
- Voice acting is alright, but sometimes it's hilarious
- Fighting enemies does have strategy as you can cancel and stagger their attacks with a well-timed swing or shot rendering them vulnerable, very rare for these indie horror games
- Easy achievements for those who crave them

Cons:
- Repetitive levels, pretty much everywhere looks the same all throughout the game
- Bullshit enemies, enemies can hit you seemingly at random when you're clearly out of range
- Very small hitboxes, you will miss plenty of revolver shots and you will hate yourself for it
- Some weapons are useless and an absolute joke, certain weapons work for certain enemies but sometimes they bug out and the final weapon is terribly underpowered and doesn't even work on the typical grunts
- The Doppleganger, you will hate this guy to your very core as he's the most bullshit enemy who is impossibly fast and can hit you from literally anywhere with a stupendous damage output and he WILL kill you but unlike all other enemies he will permanantly steal mana from the player which will piss you off
- The sprint mechanic is stupid, it's the classic "player has to stop moving to catch their breath" kind of sprinting which should never be the case and wastes the time of players and ruins the pacing of the game and it will happen all the time unless you exploit it easily by sprinting sideways or backwards
- The story is extremely thread-bare and you will find yourself not giving a single shit, I don't care about stories in games but it's a horror game, it has to have some intrigue in the story
- The final boss isn't even a boss - it's basically an arena where you fight hordes of enemies you have been fighting throughout the whole game with a great, big spoopy monster in the background (Although it does look pretty cool)
- The ending is perhaps the least satisfying ending in gaming history, sure it's going for this whole episodic thing but it just ends with blank text like an NES game saying "Conglaturation!!! A Winner is You!" and then kicks you right back to the menu - RIVETING!
- Only one difficulty called "Buttface", that's not what it's called but it's what I call it because it only has a single difficulty with no name
- 2.5 hours is far too short for the majority of people
- And finally for a 2 hour experience where there's pretty much no need to go back and play through it again especially since you will most likely get every single achievement in that one sitting without needing to even think about it

It's a game with a ton of charm and had such a promising concept that it could have been so much more but sadly it's a game that falls flat on it's arse from a 10ft drop to a concrete pavement and you'll feel really disappointed when the game finally comes to an insultingly abrupt close. Though if there will be an ACT 2 then I would love to see if the devs made some much needed improvements to really flesh the entire game out - there's a lot of potential here and I love my horror FPS a LOT. So yeah, there you have it, my pointless review on Blinding Dark which won't be read by anyone ever :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198121273308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1421575115}
review:
Blinding Dark is a pretty poor game. It felt suspenseful initially, but immersion was quickly broken by unexplained collectibles and floating labels above game elements. The graphical quality is variable throughout. Bright red blood and some low quality assets clash with the overall nice look. Forced mouse acceleration makes it difficult to move around at best, and jumps feel sluggish. The voice acting is overly dramatic and the read-aloud journal entries contain very silly phrases like “I think I might have shit in my pants back there”, which make it difficult to take the game seriously.

Despite it appearing to be a fairly short game, I did not feel like finishing it. The gameplay that I experienced consisted of searching for collectibles, platforming and killing or running away from enemies. The AI is silly. I was being chased by something and moved into an area that it apparently could not access. It walked continuously toward the invisible wall before it, and moved horizontally across the wall matching my movements like a naive Pong AI. I did not find a way to manually save, you have to meet certain checkpoints at which the game saves automatically. If you “die”, you are placed back at the checkpoint; collectibles remain acquired and enemies remain slain. If you close the game and continue, all of your progress after the checkpoint is lost.

Collision handling is a mess. Some things seem to have collision boxes that extend beyond the visible model. Crates that can be picked up will usually drop from grasp if they collide with anything else, which makes pulling them out of tight spaces and handling them in general a nit-picky process. Sometimes upon collision they will move other objects that you cannot otherwise move. I was trying to pick up a crate in between an armoire and a large desk. It pushed the desk out of the way a bit and dropped behind it, such that every time I picked it up it would push the desk a bit more. Crates can also go through some walls. I put the same desk-pushing crate through a wall and it neatly respawned, which was good because I needed it to progress. After reloading the game I had to replay this area. This time after picking up the desk-pushing crate, I immediately pushed it toward the corner formed by the desk and a wall. The large desk was flung away a healthy distance and the crate vanished instantly, never to be seen again.

If I touch this game again, it would likely be just to mess around with crate physics a bit more. Other than that, it is pretty dull to trudge through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063725672', 'num_games_owned': 10106, 'num_reviews': 458, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1416275761}
review:
[h1]Ужасная снаружи - ужасная внутри[/h1]

Плохая графика, неудобное управление, унылейший звуковой ряд/геймплей/локации - всё, что можно придумать (плохого) есть в этой игре. Ближайший аналог игре - "Nosferatu: The Wrath of Malachi", 11-летней давности, который выглядит в разы приятнее с гораздо большей проработанностью.

А, что об игре? Бегаем по коридорам, прыгаем по кочкам, составляем коробки и прыгаем по кочкам - ищем ключи, валим противников (на всю игру наверное около 30 врагов наберется, увы игру дропнул на последних уже этапах - не хватило терпения, (поэтому не ждите от игры шутана,ибо стрелять особо не в кого)), И так каждый уровень - разнообразие лишь вносят пожалуй новые виды оружия, и противников.

[h1]Итого:[/h1]

Не рекомендую даже к ознакомлению.  2.5/10

[spoiler]А, еще можно на меня подписаться в качестве steam куратора :3
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6857971-FanSH-Games/ [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097360283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1458797228}
review:
Im Grunde ein schönes Spiel mit einer tollen Atmosphäre.
!!Aber!!
Die Steuerung und Tastenbelegung ist, trotz der leichten Handhabung, recht gewöhnungsbedürftig.
Munition ist zu schnell verbraucht bei vier Schuss pro Dämon und mit der Zeremonieaxt kann man nicht blocken.
Was mich aber am meisten stört dass das Spiel sich nicht immer starten lässt.
Beim versuch es zu starten den Startvorgang abbricht und sich zusammenfaltet. Der Sound läuft an, bricht ab und das Fenster schließt sich.
Selbst ein Neustart von Steam so wie dem Rechner bringt teilweise gar nichts.

Schade, das Spiel hat verstecktes Potential.
Liebe Entwickler holt so viel wie möglich aus dem Spiel heraus, es wird sich lohnen.

Liebe Spieler, wartet mit dem Kauf noch ein Jahr. Minimum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008961044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1445894596}
review:
The game shows a lot of promise... unfortunately it is not running very well. Actually it is not running at all...
On ubuntu 14.04 LTS with latest nvidia drivers it is unplayable. The screen locks up the moment I move my mouse (only menu works). I can alt-tab out and it is responding for a brief second, then locks up again. I tried different drivers, I always have all latest updates installed.
I was told by the developer to try the game on a different pc with ubuntu installed but having in mind that this is the only game out of many that I played I think the idea is a bit ridiculous. Ubuntu 14.04 is a distro that is somewhat in the first league as far as it comes to Linux and from what I can see this game has a very lousy support for Linux os.
Be warned if you are a Linux user - potentialy you are about to buy a product that you will not be able to use at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992251029', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1408786522}
review:
Disappointing, buggy. VERY BUGGY, puzzles are... Awful. There's no guidance in this game. You're basically running through rooms, you have to check every wall in every room to make sure you don't miss the place you're supposed to go.
Puzzles basically mean "Pick up these boxes and climb up this", there's no variety at all.

The enemies are god awful. "I WILL KILL YOU" will be said about 80 times throughout this game, if not more. Your weapons are incredibly weak compared to their lores, considering your melee weapon is an axe that 'rips guts out'. It takes about 10 hits on the most common enemy to kill. 4 shots with a holy gun that's incredibly inaccurate.

Upgrading mana is probably useless, it doesn't really help much at all. The game requires a lot of movement but you have stamina for sprinting so when you're stuck in a maze (Yes, a maze!) you can't sprint through it and instead have to hear the pathetic panting of your character.

Physics are bugged out as fuck. Infact in terms of bugs, I had to exit out of the game probably 4 times because I did a stage then have the game break itself. I got trapped in rooms, had a lift go without me with no sign of it coming back, have even died trying to break a forcefield with an explosive without even trying to use it!

I recorded my gameplay of this - Around the end of the series the bugs happen more often. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_h04WcaROtI&list=UUctwhP4L0qZWJRF4r0vMQ7w

author: {'steamid': '76561197960331060', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1409767200}
review:
Als großer Fan von Horror- und Puzzle Spielen habe ich mich nach längerem Überlegen dazu entschieden Blinding Dark zu kaufen.

Grafik: ist an sich für diese Art von Spiel Okay, jedoch wiederholen sich die Räume/Gegenstände zu oft. Ab und zu treten clipping Fehler auf oder man bleibt beim Sprint auf der Treppe hängen.

Sound: die gruselige Musik ist beim Auslösen eines Triggers (z.B. Raumwechsel) einfach weg, was diesem Spiel die Atmosphäre nimmt. Der gegnerische Wortschatz ist sehr beschränkt und nervt auf Dauer (es gibt nur einen Satz: „I will kill you“) 

Physik: Man kann in der Luft durch die Betätigung der Sprinttaste beschleunigen (was bei den nervigen Sprung Passagen aber ein Vorteil ist). Zu stapelnde Kisten bleiben schräg stehen und lassen sich allgemein schlecht platzieren.

Gegner: Die Räume und Gänge sind schlecht aufgebaut, deshalb kann man den Gegnern bei Munitionsknappheit nur schlecht bis kaum ausweichen.

Fazit: Eher enttäuschend. Ich hoffe auf Verbesserungen mit den nächsten Updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997992108', 'num_games_owned': 2949, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1491312020}
review:
Edit: The game has been updated since the review and as such I am editing this.

The Developer after this review reached out to us and asked for our opinion and idea's on the game to help improve it.

While the game has some way to go it has improved a lot and there is more improvements to come and just for the fact alone that the developer is willing to listen and work with its community rather than do an Air Control or Guise of the Wolf gives me respect for them.

If you wish to see what it was like the original video is still here at the bottom of the review.

Second Video Here:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=317290767

Original Review: Quite a large disappointment, only 3 variants of puzzles which are Slide something, stack something or jump on something, occasionally mixing of these together, AI is rather broken, boxes can clip though windows meaning you can accidentally make the game impossible to finish and the voice acting is poor.

Oh and the controls don't make much sense nether...

Video review below:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=303098361

author: {'steamid': '76561198026361644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1546782769}
review:
Yay! I finally got a good indie game on Steam! Well, enough for a thumbs-up. 

+Game runs amazing on my good/modest system. Smooth framerate. 
+Weird alternate reality horror adventure. 
+Weapons have very different functions.
+10 bucks 5 hours, I got my moneys worth and would like to see where else this goes.
+not sure how long this game took to develop, but the voice actor gets better as the game goes on.

-combat works, but is pretty bad and doesn't alway express how cool the weapons/tools are.
-health/bloodspat indicator obstructs view. Why not put it with Stam/mana meter
-speaking of which...Stam/mana meter obsutructs view also. Too big even in high-res
-spiked horror guy has shinobi-ninja moves. Cheezy. 
-No ending? Would of been cool if the main character coulda said a few things before you guys rolled 
  your short indie credits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042256643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1411089734}
review:
Here is a link to my [url=http://youtu.be/RmbtBmBht60]Blinding Dark EP#1[/url] and [url=http://youtu.be/buziDR7ydPo]Blinding Dark EP#2[/url]
Thoughts on this game. I bought it since it was new, had no reviews at the time, and I like suspenseful games. For me I'm mixed - I first gave it a thumbs up and then a thumbs down...back to a thumbs up. I could go either way because I like the mystery of what is going on and that makes up for the lack of explanation in the game. 

Pros: 
The lack of knowledge keeps me wanting to find out more. 
There is a mix of spells and weapons.
Variety of puzzles to advance.

Cons:
There are some glitches to be worked out.
I found the lack of info on torch and orb frustrating - I didn't know what to do for a bit because of this.
In the first few areas there is a lot of asset and map duplication.

Overall: If your thoughts coincide with what I was talking about above - you'll probably enjoy the game. If you are on the edge to buy or not - check out some videos on YouTube or check out the demo. I think it is worth a try.

I have episodes #3 & #4 posted on my channel as well if you are interested in checking them out.
